Evans Syndrome (combination of autoimmune hemolytic anemia and immune thrombocytopenia)

Squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck

diagnoses.name: Graves' Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that results in the overproduction of thyroid hormones (hyperthyroidism). While it doesn't directly cause dyshidrotic eczema, angiomata, or easy bruising, autoimmune disorders can overlap, and hyperthyroidism can affect skin integrity.

diagnoses.name: Ehlers-Danlos Syndromes
diagnoses.description: A group of disorders that affect connective tissues supporting the skin, bones, blood vessels, and many other organs and tissues. It can explain easy bruising, and possibly periodontal disease due to connective tissue involvement. However, it doesn't directly explain hyperthyroidism or angiomata.

diagnoses.name: Von Willebrand Disease
diagnoses.description: A bleeding disorder that can explain easy bruising. It doesn't directly explain the other symptoms but could contribute to a broader picture of systemic disease.

diagnoses.name: Hemochromatosis
diagnoses.description: An iron overload disorder. It doesn't directly cause the listed symptoms but can lead to multiple organ dysfunctions including skin and endocrine issues, possibly leading to or exacerbating some symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Scurvy
diagnoses.description: A disease resulting from a lack of vitamin C. It could explain easy bruising and periodontal disease. It's less directly related to the other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia
diagnoses.description: A disorder that leads to the development of abnormal blood vessels (which could be interpreted as angiomata). It's less directly related to the other symptoms but could explain bleeding and bruising issues.

diagnoses.name: Beçhet's Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder causing blood vessel inflammation throughout the body. While it can lead to symptoms affecting the skin and possibly mouth, its direct connection to the specific symptoms listed is less clear.

diagnoses.name: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis
diagnoses.description: A disorder where the body produces too many Langerhans cells, leading to lesions that could resemble angiomata. The connection to the other symptoms would be more indirect.

diagnoses.name: Psoriasis
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune condition that can lead to dyshidrotic eczema-like skin presentations. While not directly causing hyperthyroidism or easy bruising, systemic involvement can affect overall health and may contribute to a complex symptom picture.

diagnoses.name: Gorlin Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder that could lead to various neoplasms and cysts, possibly presenting as angiomata. Its link to the other symptoms is more indirect but worth considering due to the variety of symptoms it can cause.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.description: An allergy-related condition where the immune system responds to allergens with symptoms like sneezing, itchiness, and a stuffy nose. It can also affect the eyes and throat.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder that attacks the glands responsible for keeping the eyes, mouth, and other parts of the body moist and lubricated, causing dry eyes and mouth, among other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Sleep Apnea
diagnoses.description: A sleep disorder characterized by pauses in breathing or periods of shallow breathing during sleep. It can lead to frequent waking and fatigue, among other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Conjunctivitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid. It can cause redness, itching, and irritation of the eyes.

diagnoses.name: Viral Upper Respiratory Infection
diagnoses.description: Commonly known as the common cold, this viral infection affects the nose, throat, and airways, leading to symptoms like coughing, a sore throat, and in some cases, eye irritation and laryngitis.

diagnoses.name: Dry Eye Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A chronic condition where the eyes do not produce enough tears or the right quality of tears to be kept moist. This leads to irritation, redness, and discomfort.

diagnoses.name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
diagnoses.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the tube connecting your mouth and stomach (esophagus). This can lead to symptoms like throat irritation and laryngitis.

diagnoses.name: Environmental Allergies
diagnoses.description: Reactions caused by exposure to environmental triggers such as pollen, dust mites, mold, and animal dander. Symptoms can include hypersensitivity reactions such as sneezing, itching, and irritated eyes.

diagnoses.name: Blepharitis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the eyelids where they become red, irritated, and itchy with dandruff-like scales forming on the eyelashes. This condition can contribute to dry and irritated eyes.

diagnoses.name: Reactive Airway Disease (RAD)
diagnoses.description: A condition that causes symptoms similar to that of asthma, such as coughing, wheezing, and shortness of breath in response to irritants. It can be associated with laryngitis due to throat irritation.

diagnoses: Immune dysregulation, polyendocrinopathy, enteropathy, X-linked (IPEX) syndrome

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.
common_symptoms: pain, stiffness or swelling in your joints
heavier than normal or irregular menstrual periods

diagnoses.name: Multiple Myeloma
diagnoses.description: A cancer that forms in a type of white blood cell called a plasma cell, which helps you fight infections by making antibodies that recognize and attack germs.
common_symptoms: Bone pain, especially in your spine or chest
Weakness or numbness in your legs

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can cause inflammation and pain in any part of your body.
common_symptoms: Butterfly-shaped rash on the face that covers the cheeks and bridge of the nose
Skin lesions that appear or worsen with sun exposure
Fingers and toes that turn white or blue when exposed to cold or during stressful periods (Raynaud's phenomenon)

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.description: A rare genetic condition that causes severe swelling, particularly of the face, arms, legs, throat, intestinal tract, or sexual organs.
common_symptoms: Rapid swelling of the hands, feet, limbs, face, intestinal tract, or airways
Swelling and pain in the intestinal tract

diagnoses.name: Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can occur within seconds or minutes of exposure to an allergen.
common_symptoms: Swelling of the face, throat, or other body parts

diagnoses.name: Migraine
diagnoses.description: A neurological condition that can cause multiple symptoms. It's frequently characterized by intense, debilitating headaches. Symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, difficulty speaking, numbness or tingling, and sensitivity to light and sound.
common_symptoms: Extreme sensitivity to light, sound, touch, and smell
Tingling or numbness in the extremities or face

diagnoses.name: Neurosarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease that affects the central nervous system, particularly the brain and spinal cord. It's a form of sarcoidosis, an inflammatory disease that can affect any organ.
common_symptoms: Weakness or numbness of an extremity

diagnoses.name: Fabry Disease
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder that results from the buildup of a particular type of fat, called globotriaosylceramide, in the body's cells. It's a type of lysosomal storage disorder.
common_symptoms: Pain in the hands and feet
Angiokeratomas (small, dark red spots on the skin)
Cloudiness of the front part of the eye

diagnoses.name: Pseudotumor Cerebri
diagnoses.description: A condition in which the pressure around your brain increases, causing headaches and vision problems. The name means 'false brain tumor,' since its symptoms are similar to those caused by brain tumors.
common_symptoms: Vision problems, including blurred vision, double vision, and temporary episodes of blindness
Ringing in the ears that pulses in time with your heartbeat

diagnoses.name: Thyroid Eye Disease (Graves' Ophthalmopathy)
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune condition in which immune cells attack the thyroid gland and can affect the eyes. It often occurs in people who have an overactive thyroid gland, a condition known as hyperthyroidism.

diagnoses: Thyroid Disorders (e.g., Graves' Disease, Hashimoto's Thyroiditis)

symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: An immune system disorder characterized by dry eyes and dry mouth, which might lead to complications such as dental cavities, yeast infections in the mouth, and lymphoma.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: Human Immunodeficiency Virus weakens your immune system by destroying important cells that fight disease and infection. A chronic, potentially life-threatening condition that can lead to symptoms such as lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow — the spongy tissue inside bones where blood cells are made.

diagnoses.name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system, which is part of the immune system. It can affect lymph nodes and lead to symptoms such as painless swelling of lymph nodes.

diagnoses.name: Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of lymphoma, which is cancer that originates in your lymphatic system. It affects the body's ability to fight infection and might cause lymphadenopathy and other related symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease characterized by systemic inflammation, which can affect the joints, skin, brain, lungs, kidneys, and blood vessels, causing widespread symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder that causes recurrent episodes of severe swelling. The swelling can occur in the limbs, face, intestinal tract, and airway.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease characterized by the formation of granulomas in multiple organs, which can impair their function.

diagnoses.name: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare, serious disorder of the skin and mucous membranes. It's usually a reaction to a medication or an infection.

diagnoses.name: Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder causing inflammation in blood vessels throughout your body. The disease can lead to numerous signs and symptoms that may seem unrelated at first.

diagnoses.name: HIV/AIDS
diagnoses.description: HIV/AIDS severely affects the immune system and can lead to increased susceptibility to infections, including pneumonia. Patients with advanced disease may experience kidney damage (HIV-associated nephropathy) and lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diagnoses.description: Diabetes can lead to a weakened immune system, increasing the risk of infections. It's also a risk factor for chronic kidney disease and atherosclerosis due to high blood sugar levels damaging blood vessels.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL)
diagnoses.description: CLL is a type of cancer that affects the white blood cells and can lead to increased susceptibility to infections. Lymphadenopathy is a common feature. Though less directly associated with kidney disease and atherosclerosis, systemic effects could theoretically contribute to their progression.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: SLE is an autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body including kidneys (lupus nephritis), increase risk of atherosclerosis and infections due to immune dysregulation and treatments that suppress the immune system. Lymphadenopathy can also occur.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA)
diagnoses.description: Like SLE, RA is an autoimmune disease that can compromise the immune system with its systemic inflammation, leading to an increased risk of infections. It’s indirectly linked to kidney disease and atherosclerosis due to systemic inflammation and potential side effects of treatments. Lymphadenopathy can also occur though less commonly.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: Sarcoidosis is characterized by the growth of tiny collections of inflammatory cells in different parts of the body, including the lymph nodes, leading to lymphadenopathy. It can also affect the kidneys and lungs, leading to chronic kidney disease and a form of pneumonia, respectively. There is an indirect link to increased susceptibility to infection and potentially atherosclerosis through systemic inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)
diagnoses.description: While CKD is listed as a symptom, it is also a potential underlying diagnosis that could be exacerbated by or lead to the other symptoms listed due to its effects on the body's fluid and waste balance, blood pressure, and erythropoietin production.

diagnoses.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
diagnoses.description: This is an autoimmune disease involving the small and medium-sized blood vessels, potentially leading to kidney failure (chronic kidney disease), lung disease including pneumonia, and could potentially affect lymph nodes. Increased risk of infection could come from both the disease and immunosuppressive treatments.

diagnoses.name: Immunodeficiency disorders (Primary or Acquired)
diagnoses.description: Primary immunodeficiencies are genetic, while acquired immunodeficiencies, like those caused by HIV/AIDS, lead to increased susceptibility to infections. Depending on the specific disorder, they could also be linked to effects on the kidneys, lymph nodes, and indirectly to atherosclerosis through infections and inflammation.

diagnoses.name: Amyloidosis
diagnoses.description: Amyloidosis results from the deposition of amyloid proteins in various tissues and organs including the kidneys, leading to chronic kidney disease. It can also lead to organ dysfunction that might manifest symptoms such as increased susceptibility to infections, and it's indirectly associated with atherosclerosis and lymphadenopathy.

diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis)
Irritable Bowel Syndrome (as a less likely differential for abdominal cramps)
Central Nervous System Infections (e.g., Meningitis, Encephalitis)
Demyelinating diseases of the central nervous system
Lupus Erythematosus with Central Nervous System Involvement
Hepatitis B or C Associated Vasculitis
Viral infections (e.g., HIV, Hepatitis C, Epstein-Barr virus)
Multiple sclerosis (as a differential for myelitis)
Vasculitis, specifically Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (Wegener's granulomatosis)
Psychiatric disorder secondary to systemic illness
HELLP Syndrome (Hemolysis, Elevated Liver enzymes, Low Platelet count)
Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA, formerly Wegener's granulomatosis)
Vasculitis (nonspecific, considering nasal and oral ulcers)
Lymphoma (considering systemic symptoms and potential CNS involvement)
Rheumatoid arthritis (with secondary Sjögren's syndrome or vasculitis)
Bone marrow disorders (e.g., aplastic anemia, myelodysplastic syndromes)
